node.title: Australia to send troops and police to Solomon Islands amid unrest
node.alt: Crowds of people mass near a police station in Honiara
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says Australian troops and police will be sent to Solomon Islands to help stabilise the island nationÂ amid growing violence and unrest.
node.content: ["Australian Defence Force personnel and federal police will be deployed\u00a0to Solomon Islands as the Pacific Island nation faces a second day of\u00a0rioting.", "Prime Minister Scott Morrison said 23 members of the Australian Federal Police would be deployed \"immediately\".", "Another 50 AFP officers will be deployed to support critical infrastructure tomorrow, as well as 43 Defence Force personnel from Army units based in Townsville.", "\"Our purpose here is to provide stability and security,\" Mr Morrison said following a meeting of the National Security Committee of cabinet this afternoon.", "The Defence deployment includes troops from the Army's 3rd Brigade,\u00a0medical personnel and military police.", "The Prime Minister said he received reports earlier today of buildings being burned in the centre of the Solomon Islands\u00a0capital\u00a0Honiara, including a large commercial building and a bank branch.", "Mr Morrison said he had received a request for assistance from Solomon Islands Prime Minister\u00a0Manasseh Sogavare under a security treaty the country signed with Australia in 2017.", "He\u00a0said he expected the Australian deployment to last \"a matter of weeks\".", "\"Our purpose here is to provide stability and security to enable the normal constitutional processes, within the Solomon Islands, to be able to deal with the various issues that have arisen,\" he said.", "\"It is not the Australian government's intention in any way to intervene in the internal affairs of the Solomon Islands, that is for them to resolve.\"", "More to come."]
